original_text:
Medicine Progress
**INSTITUTION
Patient :
**NAME[AAA , BBB]
MRN - **ID-NUM - MPACCOMMMRN
Age :
**AGE[in 50s] years
Sex :
Female
DOB :
**DATE[Jun 29 1953]
Author :
**NAME[XXX  , WWW M]
Health Status
Summary of Hospitalization :
This **AGE[in 50s] year old AA female with h/o SCA admitted to MICU **DATE[Apr 8 07] with c/o cough + green sputum , abd pain , N/V
Past Medical History :
SCA
Hepatitis C
ICH **DATE[Mar 2004]
Chronic Pain
Subjective / Events Overnight :
Pt crying in pain .
Requests change in diet in order to decrease the frequent BM s .
Physical Exam
General Appearance :
Middle aged AA female in NAD .
Cardiovascular :
S1 , S2 , M .
IRRR - rate 106 .
Respiratory :
Scattered rhonchi / wheeze .
Gastrointestinal :
+**PLACE , ND .
Musculoskeletal :
+ 2 B LE edema ankle to thigh .
+ 2 B UE edema .
Neurological :
Awake , alert , but feels " confused ."
Cont ext weakness .
Impression and Plan
Plan
Heme - h/o SCA .
Admitted in crisis .
On Aranesp .
Attending adjusted analgesia
- Oxycodone , as per pallative care .
Pulmonary - h/o asthma - Duonebs prn ; PNA - Cefepime D/c 'd - completed full course .
IV hydrocortisone - consider to taper in AM , as discussed with Dr. **NAME[VVV] .
HEENT - Group A Strep Throat - Amoxil Day #6 .
Otalgia / inc. hearing loss - ENT c/s - Floxin Otic .
Cards - A fib - Cardizem ( when BP parameters allow ) .
At this time cont same dose of Cardizem as discussed with Dr. **NAME[VVV] , Heme .
FEN - Resume regular diet .
GI - Hepatic encephalopathy - **DATE[Mar] lactulose due to frequent loose BM s .
Monitor ammonia level .
Rectal tube .
Renal - **INITIALS - Daily dosing of IV Lasix - monitor CXR .
Dose again today with 120 mg IV Lasix .
Appreciate Renal c/s - Renal US - IMPRESSION :
1. ECHOGENIC KIDNEYS COMPATIBLE WITH RENAL PARENCHYMAL DISEASE , WHICH CORRELATES WITH RECENT ABDOMINAL MR FINDINGS .
2. NO HYDRONEPHROSIS .
3. SMALL TO MODERATE PELVIC ASCITES .
Urine culture no growth .
PhosLo started .
D/c sodium bicarb b/c of concern of the sodium .
Neuro - Diffuse weakness of ext - CTH negative .
Disposition - Most likely will need d/c to SNF when stable .
Professional Services
Credentials and Title of Author **NAME[UUU] Signing this Document : PA-C
Perform by **NAME[XXX  , WWW] M
( on **DATE[Apr 19 2007] 16:24 )
Sign by **NAME[XXX  , WWW] M
( on **DATE[Apr 19 2007] 16:24 )
VERIFY by **NAME[XXX  , WWW] M
( on **DATE[Apr 19 2007] 16:24 )
